update.description:
The pull request implements a level system based on the idea that a simulation runner is responsible for loading and unloading all levels in the world.

## Dependencies:

* ~~ign-physics branch [remove_model_features](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/branch/remove_entity_features)~~
      * ~~Which in turn depends on ign-physics [pull request #46](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/46/)~~
* ~~ign-gui [pull request #182](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/182)~~


## TODOs:

* ~~Send only new entities to ign-gui instead of the whole scene when new entities are added~~
* ~~Add tests for the level manager.~~

## To test
Create a benchmark world using `benchmark.world.erb`

```
$ erb n_x=8 n_y=8 test/worlds/benchmark.sdf.erb > test/worlds/benchmark.sdf
```
Run ign-gazebo with `--levels` flag
```
$ ign-gazebo -v 4 -f test/worlds/benchmark.sdf --levels
```
Before starting the simulation, publish command velocities to the red and green vehicles.

```
ign topic -t "/model/vehicle_red/cmd_vel" -m ignition.msgs.Twist -p "linear: {x: 2.5}"
ign topic -t "/model/vehicle_blue/cmd_vel" -m ignition.msgs.Twist -p "linear: {x: 2.5}"

```
Then start the simulation.

## Levels on
![ign_gazebo_levels_on2.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/1414413745-ign_gazebo_levels_on2.gif)
## Levels off
![ign_gazebo_levels_off2.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/2684170126-ign_gazebo_levels_off2.gif)
update.title: [A-1] Levels

content.raw: Wow! thanks for catching that.
content.html: Wow! thanks for catching that.

content.raw: Committed the patch on af55811
content.html: Committed the patch on af55811

content.raw: Thanks for the clarification! It does feel like performers being assigned simulation runners will need to be done before @carromj's `A-3` demo task, not sure if he's already on it.
content.html: Thanks for the clarification! It does feel like performers being assigned simulation runners will need to be done before @carromj's A-3 demo task, not sure if he's already on it.

Thanks for adding the warning. While testing this, I realized that the code will only get here if the world has the dummy plugin though.

In fact, ign-gazebo --levels -v 4 -f ../examples/worlds/shapes.sdf doesn't load at all, unless I do this change:

diff -r eaec0df805da src/LevelManager.cc
--- a/src/LevelManager.cc       Wed Feb 06 15:22:15 2019 -0800
+++ b/src/LevelManager.cc       Wed Feb 06 15:40:34 2019 -0800
@@ -88,11 +88,14 @@
   {
     if (pluginElem == nullptr)
     {
-      ignerr << "Could not find a plugin tag with name " << kPluginName << "\n";
-      return;
+      ignerr << "Could not find a plugin tag with name " << kPluginName
+             << ". Levels will not work.\n";
     }
-    this->ReadPerformers(pluginElem);
-    this->ReadLevels(pluginElem);
+    else
+    {
+      this->ReadPerformers(pluginElem);
+      this->ReadLevels(pluginElem);
+    }
   }

   this->ConfigureDefaultLevel();

update.title: [A-1] Levels

content.raw:
Yes, multiple performers can be in the same level. "performer-centered" in this comment means that simulation runners are bound to one or more performers according to the configuration in the SDF file and that the performers almost never leave the simulation runner (the exception being interacting performers between multiple runners). They can however move in and out of levels. In terms of distributed sim, we still haven't addressed how a performers gets assigned to a specific simulation runner. 
It says on the design doc:
> The total number of runners will be predefined through SDF, as well as the affinity of levels and performers to each runner. 

We should probably create a task for setting the affinity of levels and performers.
content.html:
Yes, multiple performers can be in the same level. "performer-centered" in this comment means that simulation runners are bound to one or more performers according to the configuration in the SDF file and that the performers almost never leave the simulation runner (the exception being interacting performers between multiple runners). They can however move in and out of levels. In terms of distributed sim, we still haven't addressed how a performers gets assigned to a specific simulation runner. It says on the design doc:

The total number of runners will be predefined through SDF, as well as the affinity of levels and performers to each runner.

We should probably create a task for setting the affinity of levels and performers.

content.raw: Yes, those comments were outdated, but this prompted me to use `ChildrenByComponent` instead and remove the child links, collisions and joints of a removed model in 9e6486b. Note that only removing models directly is supported in ign-physics right now.
content.html: Yes, those comments were outdated, but this prompted me to use ChildrenByComponent instead and remove the child links, collisions and joints of a removed model in 9e6486b. Note that only removing models directly is supported in ign-physics right now.

content.raw: Yes, these are the assumptions because we use the original SDF to load models after they have been unloaded. Thanks for enumerating the assumptions and documenting them!

content.html: Suggested some documentation on pull request #154

content.raw: It would be nice to have an example world under `examples` that can be quickly tested manually. We can also add levels to the current `diff_drive` world.
content.html: It would be nice to have an example world under examples that can be quickly tested manually. We can also add levels to the current diff_drive world.

content.raw: Are these comments outdated? We now have `entityCollisionMap` and `entityJointMap`.
content.html: Are these comments outdated? We now have entityCollisionMap and entityJointMap.

content.raw: Nitpick: "system" has a specific meaning in `ign-gazebo`, maybe this can be phrased differently?
content.html: Nitpick: "system" has a specific meaning in ign-gazebo, maybe this can be phrased differently?

content.raw: Could this be a direct call to `this->levelMgr->UpdateLevelsState();` or are there plans to add more things to this function?
content.html: Could this be a direct call to this->levelMgr->UpdateLevelsState(); or are there plans to add more things to this function?

content.raw: `LoadActiveEntities` handles models and lights. Should we add lights to `UnloadInactiveEntities`?
content.html: LoadActiveEntities handles models and lights. Should we add lights to UnloadInactiveEntities?

content.raw:
There are a few assumptions here about entities that are part of a level:

* They're not moved (i.e. they retain their initial pose as described in the SDF)
* They're not modified in any other way (i.e. no systems added new components to them or modified other components)
* They're not removed during simulation
* All entities created during simulation are part of the default level

I think it's ok to have these assumptions, I'll just go ahead and document this somewhere though.
content.html:
There are a few assumptions here about entities that are part of a level:

  • They're not moved (i.e. they retain their initial pose as described in the SDF)
  • They're not modified in any other way (i.e. no systems added new components to them or modified other components)
  • They're not removed during simulation
  • All entities created during simulation are part of the default level

I think it's ok to have these assumptions, I'll just go ahead and document this somewhere though.

What do you think of adding something like

    if (nullptr == geometry.BoxShape)
    { 
      ignerr << "Level [" << name << "]'s geometry is not a box, level won't be created."
             << std::endl;
      continue;
    }

content.raw: Do you think it would be a good idea to print a warning if no performers / levels are given? For example `Asked to use levels but no <performer>s were found - levels will not work.`
content.html: Do you think it would be a good idea to print a warning if no performers / levels are given? For example Asked to use levels but no <performer>s were found - levels will not work.

content.raw: Should we use `factory->SetParent` here and for the default level, to be sure they're in the graph?
content.html: Should we use factory->SetParent here and for the default level, to be sure they're in the graph?

content.raw: Could `break` after this?
content.html: Could break after this?

content.raw: If I understand correctly, `Configure` should be done only once at startup. Could the logic in it be moved to the constructor instead?
content.html: If I understand correctly, Configure should be done only once at startup. Could the logic in it be moved to the constructor instead?

content.raw: Could you clarify this comment? I think that we're supporting several performers per runner, right?
content.html: Could you clarify this comment? I think that we're supporting several performers per runner, right?

content.raw: Right now we assume lights are not performers, but in theory a top-level light could have its pose changed and eventually move to another level.
content.html: Right now we assume lights are not performers, but in theory a top-level light could have its pose changed and eventually move to another level.

content.raw: Do we need a line like `buffer = 0.0;` here?
content.html: Do we need a line like buffer = 0.0; here?

content.raw: Works for me, approving.  I think Louise is still reviewing this.
content.html: Works for me, approving. I think Louise is still reviewing this.

content.raw: I added a todo: f511d05
content.html: I added a todo: f511d05
